newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks rise, bullish trend seen lasting. [CORRECTED 14:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks rise, bullish trend seen lasting. [CORRECTED 14:00 GMT]

text.p: Croatian stocks rose with blue chips forging ahead on Wednesday, and market players predicted that the bullish trend would last for some time.

"The current stable trend with mild growth in all share prices will continue," said one trader with a large market share, but noted a shortfall in volume for the most attractive, fully-listed issues. "Volume could be limited because neither (drugs firm) Pliva nor Zagrebacka Banka share supply is overabundant."
* Five (Corrects from Six) of ten traded issues rose, one fell and three were unchanged. One firm made a debut on the bourse.
* Most active food processor Podravka, selling 3,245 shares, added five kuna to 235.
* The only loser, Varazdinska Banka second issue stock, traded on volume of 25 units, fell to 110 from 125 kuna in August.
* Pliva gained 100 kuna to 12,100 with 48 shares sold.
* Zagrebacka ordinary shares took a 15-kuna leap to 725 kuna on volume of 1,724.
* Confectioner Kras rose 20 kuna to 295 with 175 traded units.
* Istrian seaside hoteliers flat: Jadranturist at 160 kuna on volume of 179 shares, Arenaturist and Riviera at 100 kuna with 51 and 25 shares sold respectively.
* Shipper Atlantska Plovidba traded 53 shares at 90 kuna each in a first deal.
* Volume slightly lower at 5,637 shares, turnover 2.8 million kuna.
